Harlem Week is America's largest cultural celebration. Find out what attracts millions of visitors to Harlem, the world's most famous neighborhood! Soak in some age old traditions, new trends, and the incomparable uptown style! Enjoy great food, music, and more from now through the end of August. Best of all, you can take Metro-North to Harlem-125th Street Station, which puts you right in the heart of the celebration. See a complete list of Harlem Week events, locations, dates and times at http://harlemweek.com/ For train times, see our schedules page: http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm

Dear L Line Customer: At approximately 7:15 this morning, one of the servers that manages and controls safe train movement along the line failed, causing the signal system to halt all trains in service. A second, backup server failed to fully engage the signal system. While management in our Rail Control Center implemented delay mitigation strategies and operated a truncated service between Broadway Junction and Rockaway Pkwy, we were unable to provide you with the level of morning rush hour service you have come to expect. At 8:10am, the system was properly rebooted and service resumed with residual delays. It is now stable. To ensure there are no disruptions in this evening’s rush hour service, or service this weekend, we have additional staff on standby to respond in the event there is another server failure. We apologize for any inconvenience.

Danbury Branch Saturday Morning/Early Afternoon Busing July 19 & 26

Buses will operate in place of the following Danbury Branch trains on Saturdays July 19 & 26 to accommodate planned testing of grade crossings: • Departing Danbury: 7:37 AM; 10:37 AM; 1:37 PM • Departing South Norwalk (to Danbury): 9:09 AM; 12:07 PM; 3:07 PM Buses will not operate on the train schedule, but will make connections in South Norwalk. For bus schedule and additional details, see http://bit.ly/1zndzeu
Weekend Busing: Tremont to Melrose July 19 & 20

Weekend bus service will be provided from Tremont Station to Melrose Station for all southbound trains during the weekend of July 19 & 20. Regular service is in effect for northbound trains. For more details, see http://bit.ly/1oE7qVL
Due to planned track and signal work, customers may experience slower travel times during the weekend of July 19 & 20. We appreciate your patience.

R Line – Weekday and Weeknight Planned Service Changes

NIGHTS Beginning 8:30 PM, Mon to Thu, Jul 21 – 24 R service ends early between Whitehall St and 71 Av. • The last train to Whitehall St leaves 71 Av at about 8:30 PM. • The last train to 71 Av leaves Whitehall St at about 9:30 PM. Take Metro-North to See the "King of Bachata" at Yankee Stadium, July 11 &12

Multi-platinum Latin recording artist Romeo Santos, the “King of Bachata,” will perform to sold-out crowds at Yankee Stadium on Friday, July 11 and Saturday, July 12. And what better way to get to the Stadium than to take Metro-North’s convenient, reliable and frequent “Train to the Game” service on our Hudson, Harlem and New Haven Lines? There is also plenty of shuttle service available from Grand Central Terminal and Harlem-125th Street Station! For more information, see http://bit.ly/1zkz13P

The Great Neck westbound platform work has resumed. A temporary westbound platform staircase is available for use west of the station building. The main staircase, at Barstow Road, and westbound elevator are closed until early October for the platform work. As an alternative, mobility impaired customers can access the westbound platform at Manhasset or Little Neck stations.
